name: Darn That Dream
comments: The lyrics to this song make up for its vocals.
so awesomely corny. my grandpa would LOVE this.
meh.
What???? don't get this from Miles
아름답네요.
The lyrics are pretty interesting though.
The first Miles track I've heard and not liked. It's surely a stretch to call it such, actually
"Yuck, what a horrible way to end the album." it's a bonus track on the reissues, not an album track proper.
the pitch changes are ridiculous in the vocals... i certainly wouldn't be able to do it.

This was a surprise for me to hear at the end of such an exclusively instrumental album from such an exclusively instrumental artist! A real rarity from Davis' back catalogue even if vocal jazz isn't really my cup of tea!
Man I love this... Darn that dream and bless it too. :)
Vocal jazz blows.
A wonderful Coffee-and-Rain song
Yuck, what a horrible way to end the album.

who would have guessed back then that Miles would turn out to be such an important and influential musician? this the stuff that dreams are made of.
I find all the chatter of the audience as interesting as the singer.
@ifmusicbe and  joannabotmang: I know you posted this quite some time ago but maybe you're still interested: Kenny Hagood is the one who's singing Darn That Dream on Birth of the Cool.
cool!
Excellent
this is such a rainy day in a cozy cafe song

interesting thread... if Miles sang... haven't thought about it... don't think he did, and from what I know of his music, and hearing him talk, i bet not one dollar but quite many, that IF he did, he certainly didn't do it on this one... joannabotmang, if i'm right, you're a singer yourself: couldn't you find out for us?
